content.text:
# 2010 UK Music Video Awards

| previous = 2009
| next = 2011
| main =
}}
The 2010 UK Music Video Awards were held on 12 October 2010 at the Odeon West End in Leicester Square, London to recognise the best in music videos and music film making from United Kingdom and worldwide. The nominations were announced on 20 September 2010. American rock band OK Go won Video of the Year for "This Too Shall Pass (Rube Goldberg Machine vsn)" directed by James Frost, Synn Labs and OK Go.
Video of the Year
{| class="wikitable" style="width:95%"
|- bgcolor="#bebebe"
! width="100%" |Video of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* OK Go - "This Too Shall Pass (Rube Goldberg Machine vsn)"  (Directors: James Frost, Synn Labs, OK Go)
|-
|}
Icon Award
{| class="wikitable" style="width:95%"
|- bgcolor="#bebebe"
! width="50%" |The Icon Award
|-
| valign="top" |
Hammer & Tongs
|-
|}
Video Genre Categories

|- bgcolor="#bebebe"
! width="50%" |Best Pop Video
! width="50%" |Best Rock Video
|-

Plan B - "Prayin'  (Director: Daniel Wolfe)
* Cheryl Cole - "Parachute"

* Hurts - "Better Than Love"
* Plan B - "She Said"
| valign="top" |
OK Go - "This Too Shall Pass (Rube Goldberg Machine vsn)"  (Directors: James Frost, Synn Labs, OK Go)

| valign="top" |

|-

|-
| valign="top" |
Jay Z ft. Swizz Beatz - "On to the Next One"  (Director: Sam Brown)
* Chiddy Bang - "Opposite of Adults"

* Kid Cudi - "Pursuit of Happiness"

SOUR - "Hibi No Neiro"  (Directors: Masashi Kawamura, Hal Kirkland, Who-Fu (Magico&Masayoshi))

| valign="top" |
'''Example - "Watch the Sun Come Up (Devil's Gun Zeitgeist Remix)"  (Director: Ben Newman)'''
